fields.description:
Dear All,

We want to create a new project to track computers bugs (hardware failure, Excel installation,...) without using another software that JIRA.

Due to inexperiment users with JIRA, we want to reduce user's rights.
The best way is that users just have 'Create Issues' and 'Create Attachments' in "Permission Scheme"

So, when a user long into JIRA, he only watches 'Home' and 'Create New Issue' menus.

We can setup this environment for users, but when an issue is assigned, users are not notified by mail.

After tests, we found that to notify users, they must be members of 'Browse Projects' permission.

Is there anyway to notify users by email without 'Browse Projects' rights ?

Thanks in advance
Regards
fields.summary: Email Notification
"Unresolveable" Versions

fields.description:
I'd like to see a new a feature to manage "deliveries" or "vendor drops". Basically, we would like to a new operation called "Add vendor drop" in the version manager (ManageVersions.jspa).

First, each project should define a svn repository (for instance http://svn.bdf.fr/projectA/vendor/). This should be done with a custom field (?) rather than a java properties file.

In the "Manage versions" screen, next to a given version name (eg "1.2.3") the new "Add vendor drop" operation should allow the project admin to upload a zip/tgz file to Jira (for instance "My Documents\projectA.zip") As a result, Jira should decompress the file, commit it into the svn repository in "current" (ie  http://svn.bdf.fr/projectA/vendor/current) as well as in the selected version (ie copy http://svn.bdf.fr/projectA/vendor/current into  http://svn.bdf.fr/projectA/vendor/1.2.3). And Jira should release version "1.2.3".

The goal of this process is to :
- offer a very simple interface to push vendor drops into svn
- avoid the overhead (and possible inconsistency) of defining the version in svn, when it was already done Jira
fields.summary: "Vendor drop" operation in the Version Manager
Move components into their own manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10149].
  {panel}

It would be nice and useful if the number of versions shown in the RoadMap or ChangeLog was configurable and navigatable.
We have projects that have quite a lot versions that can't be archived and must be shown in the version selectors, roadmaps and changelogs.
Up to now there are only two options when browsing the changelog and roadmap: *next 3 versions* and *all versions*.
If you have lots of versions (lets say 20) the roadmap/changelog gets slow and long and not very usable (in means of usability)

Thus I'd like to see a page naviagor (just as with long issue navigator pages) like _<<_ *1*_|2|3 >>_ to switch forward and back trough the roadmap/changelog
fields.summary: Number of Versions shown in RoadMap and ChangeLog

fields.description:
When I configure repositories in subversion-jira-plugin.properties I used to specify the repositories linke:

svn.root=http://uptoip-repos.ams.stiwa.com/
svn.root.1=http://buildingci-repos.ams.stiwa.com/

This is not working anymore! I get an error:

{{2006-05-08 21:28:30,580 ERROR [plugin.ext.subversion.SubversionManagerImpl] Connection to Subversion repository http://uptoip-repos.ams.stiwa.com failed: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: No part of path '' was found in repository HEAD}}

To resolve this I have to specify the rpositories with a relative path:

svn.root=http://uptoip-repos.ams.stiwa.com/trunk
svn.root.1=http://buildingci-repos.ams.stiwa.com/trunk

But this is unsatifactory since changes (commits) in branches /branches) are not indexed and shown in JIRA.
fields.summary: Subversion Plugin: Repository URLs with no realtive repository path not working

fields.description:
Currently Tomcat re-use their output buffers (ostensibly for performance), but if you serve a large amount of HTML (say 10MB) the buffers sit around forever, and don't get cleaned up.  Note that Orion also has this problem.

There is a flag "org.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER" that you can set which limits this.  We should set it in the standalone versions, and also let people to know to set it in their own Tomcat instances.

If you are using Tomcat you *must* set the following in your java options:
{noformat}
-Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true
{noformat}

Note that this option is only available for Tomcat 5.5.15 and above. All earlier Tomcat 5 builds are susceptible to this problem and should be upgraded.

In JIRA Standalone this is set in the bin/setenv.sh or bin/setenv.bat by default.

If you do not set this you will get OutOfMemoryErrors.
fields.summary: Set tomcat flag to not re-use buffers, as they result in OutOfMemoryErrors

fields.description:
When moving an issue from one project to another it always ends up as ??Unassigned??.
This is not about permissions, it happens  when I move issues assigned to 'normal' users as well as issues assigned to myself (administrator & assignable user), and it is possible to assign the issue manually to the same user afterwards.

In step 3 of the move process, JIRA says
{quote}
Move Issue: Update Fields
Step 3 of 4: Update the fields of the issue to relate to the new project.

Note: Step 2 is not required.
All fields will be updated automatically.
{quote}

In step 4, the ??Original Value?? cell of the ??Assign to?? row contains the current assignee (highlighted red), the ??New Value?? field contains just a blank.


Cheers,
Jens
fields.summary: assignee gets lost when issue is moved

fields.description:
To keep the web interface uncluttered, we should limit the usage of things that don't make sense.

We should not allow people to create custom events until they have a custom workflow.  This will link these two systems together in people's minds, and make it simpler to conceptualize.
fields.summary: Don't allow customisation of events until you have a custom workflow

fields.description:
Need to investigate the _ejb_location_ setting within the app server configurations.

At present, using Orion 2.0.2 and MS SQL Server, with the _ejb_location_ setting configured in the _data-sources.xml_, results in errors regarding attempts to commit a transaction while in *auto_commit* mode. 

This problem can be replicated while attempting a workflow migration (a JIRA managed transactional operation).

Need to investigate this setting on the other App Servers (e.g. Tomcat, Resin) and databases (e.g. Postgres, HSQL).

Also, investigate the need to set *auto_commit* to false while executing JIRA transactional operations - or does Ofbiz do this automatically.
fields.summary: Investigate ejb_location setting within App Server configuration

fields.description:
To re-produce:

1. Create an issue with 'X' security level
2. Create a sub-task for that issue
3. Filter for the above issues in the Issue Navigator configuring it to include the Security Level column -> Security Levels show 'X'
4. Edit parent issue to use 'Y' security level
5. Filter for the above issues in the Issue Navigator again -> Security Levels show 'Y' for parent but 'X' still for sub-task
fields.summary: Editing parent issue security level is not reflected for sub-tasks when viewed in Issue Navigator

fields.description: When an issue is imported with an assignee that does not exist within JIRA the import completes fine and the user is created as a member of the jira-user group but if you navigate to the Default Permission Scheme (the only Scheme available) members of the jira-developers group are the only users that have assignable permissions.
fields.summary: CSV importer doesn't respect the Assignable User Permission

fields.description:
Often times when trying to click in the QUICK SEARCH textbox, I will accidently click one of the links right above it, such as the Log Out link.  I have had this complaint from a few more of our JIRA users, asking if the links can be moved up, since they too often click on them by accident trying to use the QUICK SEARCH box.  

My suggestion would be to just move them up top aligned with the top row (a few pixels from the top of the page).
fields.summary: Move top bar links -- Filters | Profile | Log Out | Print | Help -- to top of screen

fields.description:
This is probably a duplicate of http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7257, but that issue has not been addressed in quite some time, so I thought it wouldn't hurt to re-up it as a request for 3.6.x.

The Cascading Select customfield is extremely useful.  It would be even better if a Multi-select version of the custom field existed, that allowed multiple values to be selected from either of the Cascading Select menus.  Is this:

a) Possible without the creation of another custom field [if so, is there some example that I was unable to find in a web search]?
b) Something that could be added as a custom field type?

Thanks for any responses.
fields.summary: Multi-select from Cascading Select Customfield

fields.description: I frequently use our Jira over a VPN running on either an overloaded Wifi, or through GPRS/EDGE. I noticed from Firefox's status bar that a ton of connections are being made during a page load. This can cause even the simplest page loading from the fastest server to still take 10 to 20 seconds to download, due to the multiple roundtrips that are required grinding things to a halt on high-latency connections. Can anything be done to improve this? Every time my browser has to touch the server we tack on another double latency to the local page render time..
fields.summary: Reduce number of connections made to server to help high latency connects like VPN over wifi

fields.description:
I just upgraded JIRA from 3.3.1 to 3.6.1

One of my projectleaders used to select Printable in the Issue Navigator to get a nice long list of his issues.
The shown issue keys were hyperlinked, so he could click on them to get the issue details.
This functionality is now gone.

I noticed that while the page is loading the hyperlinks are still there, hovering the mouse over an issuekey shows a correct URL.
The moment the page finished loading, the links are gone...
jira.atlassian.com (also running 3.6.1#154 at the moment) shows the same behaviour.

IMO It is correct that the issuekeys are not shown as links, i.e. they are not underlined, as this is a print layout.
The hyperlink functionality makes it a useful view for non-printing use.
Can this functionality be restored, or has it been removed by design?

cheers
fields.summary: Issue Navigator - Printable: issue keys are no longer clickable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10114].
  {panel}

Currently we have:
 - UpdateIssueFieldFunction which can set an issue's assignee to a certain user
 - AssignToLeadFunction
 - AssignToReporterFunction

and there's a proposal for an "assign to current user" function (JRA-5819).

It seems silly having all these slightly different post-functions. We should enhance UpdateIssueFieldFunction to list "Current assignee", "project lead", "component lead" and "reporter".
fields.summary: Unify assign workflow post-functions

Generating release notes that can be use by people who does not have acces to JIRA. 

I would like to see a possibility to create releasenotes where details of alle issues for that spesific release was included in the releasenotes document where the issue links on the "frontpage" (as today) linked to internal pages (detail about the issue) in the document. 

This way it would be possible to ship a complete document describing the changes for the release.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Authenticate into Jira and use the Remember Me feature so your authentication is remembered.
2) Go to an issue screen which shows Fix For and Affects Version links.
3) Copy the link to clipboard.
4) Restart your browser so your session is reinitialized.
5) Paste the URL to your browser's address bar.
6) Try to click on either Fix Version or Affects Version links - Jira throws a NumberFormatException.

For example, here's the Fix For Version URL I get here on jira.atlassian.com when viewing issue CONF-6023 screen.

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&sorter/order=ASC&sorter/field=priority&pid=10470;jsessionid=123&fixfor=11890;jsessionid=123

AFAIK this has been fixed a number of times so I guess it's a regression? Also note the jsessionid is included twice in this URL while most URLs on the screen don't include the GET parameter at all.
fields.summary: jsessionid twice in URL causes Fix and Affects version links to break in issue view screen during session's first page view

fields.description:
Currently the Quick Search has a funky yellow tooltip that says 'Learn more about +Quick Search+', with a hyperlink. This could be useful to provide tooltip documentation for other functionality in JIRA. For example:

* XML link on the issue navigator screen (describe RSS, etc.)
* preview button to the right of the description in create/edit issue screen

Alternatively, you could use it to provide a snippet of the target of a link in some places. For example, on the Summary hyperlink in the issue navigator, provide a tooltip with the first 100 characters of the issue's description. This would sometimes save launching the incorrect issue. There may be performance concerns with this, of course.
fields.summary: Use funky tooltips for other features in JIRA

Is there way to download the applet and install it locally on Jira server so clients won't be forced to install it from Internet.

Taras Kopach
East Bay Municipal Utility District
Oakland, CA 
USA
tkopach@ebmud.com

fields.description:
Hello,

Since upgrading to JIRA 3.6 Enterprise (standalone) over the weekend, the e-mail handler that helps create and comment on issues has a problem where it keeps posting the same comments over and over again. From what I see, the user replies to an e-mail to add a comment made in a reported JIRA issue, but it appears that JIRA is not cleaning up the message off from the mail server once it processes. Becaus of this, we keep getting the same message over and over again until I can manually delete it off myself from the mail server. Looking at the log, here's what I see:

2006-05-05 07:22:56,793 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Creating attachment without a file.  Aborting
2006-05-05 07:22:56,825 ERROR [service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler] Exception while creating attachment for issue IQ-3400: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeLogUtils.createChangeGroup(ChangeLogUtils.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.DefaultIssueUpdater.doUpdate(DefaultIssueUpdater.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler.addChangeHistoryItem(AbstractCommentHandler.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentWithPart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMultipart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:209)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentsForMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:184)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
2006-05-05 07:22:56,825 WARN [service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler] Exception creating comment null
java.io.IOException
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentWithPart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMultipart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:209)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentsForMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:184)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)

The same block appears over and over again in the log, until I remove the offending message from the mail server. We never had any problems before JIRA 3.6 and I don't see anything special about the e-mail message that causes it to get "stuck" in the mail queue since it was just a comment with no attachments. Any help is appreciated.

Nordy Isaac

JRA-8326

The issue with key FXX-253 has a status of Open which is not a valid status for the issues workflow, contact Atlassian support to resolve this problem. 
JRA-8326 

I haven't attached the full listing but all 185 issues are listed.

fields.description:
Add a doc that the *no count* setting should not be set for MS SQL Server.

Further details on this setting are available at:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/tsqlref/ts_set-set_3ed0.asp

This setting will result in errors where JIRA attempts to retrieve the next sequential ID based on the value returned from executed statements. The doc should include screenshots as how to unset this setting following these instructions:

This can be verified by clicking on the server from within the SQL Server Management screen. From here, please select the *Connections* option and verify

fields.summary: Add doc that *no count* setting should not be checked for MS SQL Server

fields.description:
due to JRA-9934 status arguments to the SubTaskBlockingCondition workflow condition are being polluted with values like "nested" and "count" where only status id numbers should be. Create an upgrade task to clean out these erroneous statuses in workflow transitions with SubTaskBlockingCondition.

The existence of these wrong statuses doesn't affect the workflow functionality, only in the rendition of the condition view in the workflow editor screen.
fields.summary: create upgrade task to clean out erroneous statuses in workflow transitions with SubTaskBlockingCondition

fields.description: The *Issue Security Scheme* doco is in serious need of an update. It is currently referencing features (i.e. the Default Issue Security Scheme) that have not existed for some time. The screenshots need to be updated as well.
fields.summary: Update the Issue Security Scheme Documentation

fields.description:
Exporting an issue to word displays description twice as it displays both the "hidden"/ longer version of the description as well as the shown version of it

This was probably introduced with the hide long description feature
fields.summary: Exporting an issue to word displays descrption twice

fields.description:
---- From email ----

Hi there,

i am not sure if this is relevant here, but we just discovered a small error in the notification mail when changing the assignee

--- Snip ---
Bearbeiter: Antje Lange (QC)  (wurde: Willy Gielen (QC))
--- Snap ---

"wurde" in German means "became".
The correct translation would be "war: Willy Gielen (QC)"

Is there any way that we can change this ourselves?

Brgds
Willy
fields.summary: Translation error in notifications for German
Issue Navigator - the query summary description should use OR instead of AND when displaying a multiple field search summary
Add Spell Check to the related fields

fields.description:
I can translate all messages that send the Jira system to users, but i can't find where can i translate all texts of mail subject.

I translate to spanish all 'template.*' from 'MailingListCompiler_es_ES.properties' file (attached to this issue, please update i18), but i still receive the following subject:
''[SoporteBigun] Assigned: (NOM-2) Nueva función"
Where is defined i18 text of 'Assigned'?

On the other hand, i want to ask you if is possible to define a custom "Account Creation" message in Html format?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Mail subject without internalisation
Refactor permissions code to get rid of "jira.issue.subtasks-creatable"

fields.description: The JSESSIONID cookie of the screenshot attachment java applet appear to overwrite the Jira login JSESSIONID, causing the login session to close. Unable to log back into Jira until the cookies are cleared.
fields.summary: Screenshot attachment applet cause closed session on Websphere 6.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10075].
  {panel}

It would be very useful for us to have two new permission added to JIRA's set of permissions
 - edit sub-task
 - delete sub-task

(We want to be able to assign those permissions to Reporter.)
fields.summary: Add "Edit sub-task" and "Delete sub-task" permissions

fields.description:
I attempt to attach a file to an existing issue, and receive the following error, as demonstrated in the attached screenshot:

"Error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class: com.atlassian.jira.web.JiraMultipartRequestWrapper(original message: null)
The issue no longer exists."

The problem is consistently reproducible.  When I attach a zipped version of the file, I have no such problem.

I was trying to attach the file SUP-559.tcpdump to the issue JSP-4997 in jira.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Attaching a file results in an "The issue no longer exists".

fields.description: Enable project administrator edit project notification scheme (maybe only if its notification scheme is assigned only to it).
fields.summary: Enable project administrator edit project notification scheme.

Check Issue Relations

 {code}

(should read something like _issue has been removed_)

fields.description:
I followed the instructions on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Varying+assignable+users+by+transition to get different assignable Users on each transistion. Because no user is allowed to set properties begining with "jira." I decided to to modify the code at ..."jira.issue.assignables"... to ..."jiraext.issue.assignables".... After compiling (with maven) and replacing CommentAssignIssue.class and WorkflowUtil.class I restarted jira. No Errors occoured in log. In a workflow with a transition containing a property "jiraext.issue.assignables" this has no effect on the list of assignable users. Therefore I decided to put some debug output in each method of CommentAssignIssue.java to see which methods are called. Compiled, Replaced, Restarted... getAssignableUsers is never called :-(
Is this a Bug?
Am I doing something wrong?

We do need different assignable users on each transition because of a large Team with many roles and a complex workflow.
Thanks.
fields.summary: "Varying assignable users by transition" does not work

fields.description:
We have two projects that share a common custom field (cascading select) between them. Each project has a distinct context for the field. When we move an issue from one project to another, the "Move Issues" screen doesn't pop up the shared field as one that needs to be updated as part of the move process. As a result, the moved issue now appears in the new project with an invalid, left over from the original project value. My users have to remember to go back and edit the moved issue after the fact to update the shared field's value to be valid in the new project.

For example, 
*Cascading SelectA*
Context: Project A, All issues types
Options a-1, b-1, c-1

Context Project B, All issue types
Options: x-1, y-1, z-1

The cascading select field has different contexts for each project.  The problem is that when I move an issue from Project A with a value of "a-1" to project B, it retains the value of "a-1" and I'm never prompted to map it to the values appropriate to project B. 

This is a fairly serious problem because we define work queues in our different divisions based on this cascading select.  If an issue is moved from one project to another with an invalid value in this custom field, it is, in effect, invisible to the folks in the destination and will languish.
fields.summary: Cascading select custom field doesn't pop up in the "Move Issue" screen if the field has a context in source and destination projects.

fields.description:
It would be beneficial if users had the ability to copy their origianl application properties file from an older version of JIRA to a new version.

At present, users are directed to merge old settings from previous properties files to the new propeties file.

A possible solution would be to have two properties file:

* User Maintained Properties
* System Default Properties

In this scenario, the user can copy their properties from version to version with the ability to copy and over-ride any properties found in the system default file.
fields.summary: Provide mechanism to allow users to copy old app properties from previous version to new version

fields.description:
Currently, if a component (custom field etc) wants to include javascript or css, it has to manually include it in the page.  This increases the page load time.

Another problem is that if javascript is needed on a few pages, there is a tendency to just include it at the top of _all_ pages.  (eg the javascript for the wysiwyg editor).  Including all the javascript on the first page has the effect of making JIRA appear slow.

Components should be able to specify that they need javascript / css, and it be rendered at the top of the page.

One way in which this could be implemented is using content tags inside the html, and then in the decorators, pulling out the content tags, and specifying the javascript that is needed.  That way if more than one content tag was specified, then only one file would be served.  This is a clean separation of concerns, and also reduces the amount of bandwidth that is needed.
fields.summary: Allow components to specify javascript or style sheets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10045].
  {panel}

Whilst looking through the HTML of JIRA, there seems to be a lot of inline javascript (and styles) that could be moved into javascript include files.

A few examples that I came across:
- luckysearch()
- showtooltip()
- showcomment / hidecomment()

There are probably more.  Moving these out into include files would reduce the amount of HTML that is shown.
fields.summary: Remove inline javascript from pages

fields.description:
It would be helpful to be able to create "issue carts".  An issue cart would be able to contain specific issues rather than just search parameters.  This solves a problem that cannot currently be solved with subtasks or versions.

Take, for example, a developer who has 30 issues assigned to him.  Out of those 30, he plans to work on a group of five issues first, a group of ten next, and the remaining issues last.  The five first issues could be put in one cart, the ten issues in another, and the remaining fifteen in another cart.  An issue cart would be the best way to handle this since the issues aren't related by context or by release version.

It is also useful since carts would be able to be private rather than affecting the issues for everyone, as relating or versioning issues will.  This way, a person can have a private way of grouping issues.  Ideally, a cart would be able to be shared like a filter.
fields.summary: Ability to add issues to "issue carts"

fields.description:
Hi,

I fell on a small problem and I think its a little bug in the cascading select implementation for a portlet properties. I saw that the type was now supported and that the Statistics portlet was using it. More precisely I based my implementation on FilterStatisticsCascadingSelectValuesGenerator (com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics).

Everything works fine with only one property set to the "cascading select" type in the atlassian-plugin.xml file. However, when I add a second one, it deactivates the first one. All the ValuesGenerator classes are called appropriately and the Maps for the dropdown lists are correctly generated. The problem is introduced in the JavaScript code generation to call the Javascript dynamicSelect() function.

If you look at the source code of the properties page you can see :
  
<script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript" src="/includes/js/cascadingUtil.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
window.onload = function()
{
   dynamicSelect("projectid_select", "versionid_select");
}
</script>

followed a little farther by another declaration but for the other property :

<script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript" src="/includes/js/cascadingUtil.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
window.onload = function()
{
   dynamicSelect("projectid_select", "component_select");
}
</script>

This overwrites the window.onload function pointed to, and only the last read declaration will be executed. Therefore I think a simple mechanism should be implemented to stack functions to the window.onload event.

Thank you for your time
fields.summary: Bug in the generated Javascript code for multiple portlet properties of type cascading select

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10033].
  {panel}

The addComment method appears to work for most comment content, but not URLs.  I've been trying to determine why, but I just don't have enough information about how this works.  

If I include a comment:
---SNIP---
This is a link to:
slashdot.org
---SNIP---

JIRA adds this fine, but if I include a comment:
---SNIP---
This is a link to:
http://slashdot.org
---SNIP---

JIRA returns a 500 with the following fault information:
---SNIP---
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"><soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault><faultcode>soapenv:Server.userException</faultcode><faultstring>org.apache.axis.types.URI$MalformedURIException: The scheme is not conformant.</faultstring><detail><faultData xsi:type="ns1:URI$MalformedURIException" xmlns:ns1="http://types.axis.apache.org"/><ns2:hostname xmlns:ns2="http://xml.apache.org/axis/">[internal hostname removed]</ns2:hostname></detail></soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>
---SNIP---

It is an xs:string field, so I don't understand why having a URL scheme in the content makes any difference.  If I had a full stack trace and the code I'd look it up myself, but I don't even see a stack trace in any of the jira logs on the filesystem.

I'd like to have the fully-qualified URL in the comment so users can click on it, but I don't know how to make it work.  I tried wrapping it in [CDATA[]], but that was no help.  I tried URL-encoding it, but it was not URL-unencoded on the other end.  I'm out of ideas.
fields.summary: SOAP addComment method does not accept URLs using SOAP::Lite
